channel.title: Port Fowarding Problems.. (Belkin Router)
channel.description:
Hey, I'm having problems i'm guessing with port fowarding, because my cousin can't get on or anyone else, but when I had wired internet, there was no problem... I have a BELKIN Router model #F5D9230-4 Here is a pic:
[img]http://i209.photobucket.com/albums/bb205/sithling/Portfoward.jpg[/img]
What's wrong with it?
Any help will be greatly greatly appreciated.
Thanks, Sithling.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: February 10, 2008, 03:27:02 AM[/size][hr]Sorry for the double post, I'll remove it after I get my answer, Please someone, I really need help![br][br][size=1]Posted on: February 10, 2008, 03:37:46 AM[/size][hr]Someone please help.

@Kalphiter wrote:

[quote=“Sithling, post:11, topic:180150”]Ok i’ll try that[/quote]It does not submit correctly on Firefox. Use Internet Explorer.

item.title: Port Fowarding Problems.. (Belkin Router)
item.dc:creator: @freaky5000 freaky5000
item.description:
@freaky5000 wrote:

I have a problem 2, thing is linksys is totally diferent to belkin so we cant follow tutorial prperly because we do not have the “Application & games” section… So far i have done portforwading MySQL1 and 2, 3306 ports.

So now i need to portforward the game port 43594 or whatever it is… But with this one you use your “IP ADDRESS”, that it says when you type ipconfig in your cmd which is the top 1 out of the the that is gives you. So instead of putting the last number as 192.168.2.1, my ip is 192.168.2.?? so i put the ip last 2 numbers in, of what people have been needing help with i have just figured this out.

Read full topic

item.title: Port Fowarding Problems.. (Belkin Router)
item.dc:creator: @Agent766 Agent766
item.description:
@Agent766 wrote:

Make sure that the 1 in the box isn’t supposed to be somehting else. Usually it’s something like 100. It’s supposed to be the IP of your computer so go to Start > Run > type cmd > type ipconfig and you should get 192.168.2.*. That * should be in that IP box.

Read full topic
